data.title: Physically Based Rendering Support
data.body:
This is a feature request that I would like to see implemented into the atomic game engine.

I have linked an overview below for Artists as well as one for programmers. This should give you a general overview for what needs to be done and why it is beneficial to the engine.

PBR for Artists
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LNwMJeWFr0U

PBR for Programmers
http://blog.selfshadow.com/publications/s2013-shading-course/#course_content

Further reading - 
http://jmonkeyengine.org/299803/physically-based-rendering-part-one/
http://jmonkeyengine.org/300495/physically-based-rendering-part-two/
http://jmonkeyengine.org/301308/physically-based-rendering-part-3/

data.title: Node based Shader Editor similar to Unreal Material Editor
data.body:
Hey @JoshEngebretson - I have a feature request for Atomic Game engine.
A visual Shader editor similar of that to the Unreal Material Editor. 
I am requesting this for one reason - 

Let artists focus more on art opposed to the technical stuff behind the art. A node based material Editor would allow me as an artist to work faster and make a better looking game.

I have also linked the Strumpy Shader Editor for Unity3D. it is written in C# and could possibly be used in the Atomic Game engine. It is available under the MIT license.

https://github.com/stramit/SSE

data.title: Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
data.body:
### AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@JoshEngebretson has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine](https://gitter.im/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:

[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).

Happy chatting.

PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

data.title: [iOS] - Implement code signing for native iOS platform
data.body: This is required for shipping on the App Store and Google Play

data.title: Add C++ example which doesn't require any Javascript
data.body: It is possible to use Atomic as a C++ codebase and not use any Javascript, need an example showing this

data.title: New Scene, new node, add component functionality
data.body: Make is possible to create a new scene, node, and add a node component via the Editor

data.title: Improve integrated JS editor
data.body: Add automatic indentation and block when typing {}, code folding, autocomplete improvements (and fixes)

data.title: Add support for importing FBX, OBJ, etc in the Atomic Editor
data.body: This includes static and animated models

data.title: NPM installable Atomic CLI
data.body: It should be possible to create atomic projects, compile, and run them on device via a NPM installable Atomic CLI interface

data.title: Enable a bridge between Atomic JS and the JS in the browser page
data.body: Make it possible to talk to the JS in the browser page from Atomic

data.title: Make embedding the Atomic player in a page possible
data.body: Right now, deployment on html5 creates a standalone page for testing purposes, it should be possible to embed the player in an existing page

data.title: Deployment option for 2D only HTML5 builds to minimize player size
data.body: Add a deployment and separate build for 2D only HTML5 builds to remove unnecessary features such as 3D rendering/physics to minimize player size, integrate this with the HTML5 deployment options window

data.title: Linux Editor
data.body: Support Linux as an editor platform

data.title: Linux Player
data.body: Support Linux as a player deployment target

data.title: Build Improvements
Cant build on Ubuntu 14.04 64 bits

data.title: Prepass lighting on OSX/Integrated GPU has artifacts when PointLight and DirectionalLight are combined on a surface
Add spriter example to the welcome frame
On New Projects, prompt for project name and then get root folder
File open only gave the message about closing current project first time
right click paste of key not working in product key entry
Light2D player light at nighttime has visual artifact at higher resolutions
A tip window for initial project load describing hierarchy, resource, inspector views and basic operations
Add tip window system with "don't show me this again" checkbox
Ensure Windows keyboard shortcuts match menubar (F3, Ctrl-Y, etc)
Scene::GetComponent(unsigned) overloads Node::GetComponent(StringHash)
Keyboard focus issues in play mode
data.body: Keyboard input is being accepted by text edits, etc during play mode

data.title: Scroll issues on listviews and other layouts
data.body: Vertical scrolling is flakey in Resource/Hierarchy/inspector frames

data.title: Inspector sizing issues, causes main screen to scroll horizontally
data.body: Probably hide inspector on welcome frame and potentially when non-scene resource being edited

data.title: Clear editor view3D rendertarget, so there isn't garbage displayed at startup
